intro: Porpax lasiorhiza, commonly known as the soft-stemmed puccoon, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Porpax lasiorhiza is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its rhizomes are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
